How did I1 become Germanic?

From 2800 BCE, a large-scale cultural and genetic upheaval hit Scandinavia with the arrival of the Indo-Europeans from Eastern Europe, who introduced the Copper Age and Early Bronze Age to the region practically without Neolithic transition. The first Indo-Europeans to reach Scandinavia were the Corded Ware people from modern Russia, Belarus and Poland, who are thought to have belonged predominantly to haplogroup R1a, with a minority of R1b and I2a. These people shared some similar maternal lineages as Scandinavian I1 inhabitants, including mtDNA haplogroups U2e, U4 and U5, but also brought many new lineages such as H2a1, H6, W and various subclades of I, J, K and T.

The second major Indo-European migration to Scandinavia was that of haplogroup R1b-U106, the branch that is thought to have introduced Proto-Germanic languages, as an offshoot of the Proto-Celto-Germanic speakers from Central Europe. R1b probably entered Scandinavia from present-day Germany as a northward expansion of the late Unetice culture (2300-1600 BCE). The oldest known R1b sample in Scandinavia dates from the Nordic Bronze Age circa 1400 BCE (see Allentoft 2015 above).

According to the Germanic substrate hypothesis, first proposed by Sigmund Feist in 1932, Proto-Germanic was a hybrid language mixing Indo-European (R1b, and to a lower extent R1a) and pre-Indo-European (Mesolithic I2 and Neolithic G2a and I1) elements. This hybridisation would have taken place during the Bronze Age and given birth to the first Proto-Germanic civilization, the Nordic Bronze Age (1700-500 BCE).

>>33711763
>Sure dude, the only group associated to saturn were the farm boyos.

Underlying the well-known link between Saturday (Shabbat in Hebrew) and Saturn (Shabbetai in Hebrew) is the reference to Saturn as the planet in charge of the Jews.
Behind the link between Saturn and Saturday is the astrological theory that assigns the seven planets in succession, beginning with the sun and following the order of their orbs,
to the 24 hours of the day and to the seven days of the week.

Prominent Roman historians such as Tacitus (56–120 CE) and Cassius Dio (ca. 155–after 229), as well as Church fathers like Augustine (354–430),
acknowledged a special link between Saturn and Saturday, the holiest day of the week for the Jews.
That Jewish society of the talmudic period recognized the same association is shown by the fact that the Babylonian Talmud (Shabbat 156a) refers to Saturn as Shabbetai, i.e., the star of Shabbat (Saturday).

Greek and Arab astrology, however, considered Saturn to be the most malignant of the seven planets; and thus the Jews, astrologically governed by Saturn, were considered to be contaminated by the planet’s wicked nature.

As I think of those impossible realities, I can't help but wonder if I was overly harsh.

Just look how many people here lost interest in human relationships. Had I done likewise, wouldn't I have grown to despise humanity? Even in the reality I live in, I was so close to giving in to malice. Hadn't I taken it out on myself, then others instead.

My need for a place to belong, stemming from isolation in my childhood, defined me. When I was 14, I thought maybe if I just were a cute girl, perhaps I could make friends. That was enough to finally push me over the edge, to take action to change who I am in the eyes of society. Had I realised that there were beings who already accepted me just as I was astrally, it wouldn't have come to that so soon; if not for the social aspects of it, stemming from my desire to belong with humans at all, I'm confident I could've found ways to cope with my dysphoria for decades, if not a full lifetime.

In this life, where I rejected her advances as much as I could but later accepted her in a familial sense, I've found my place in human society. Now I strive to become like a deity, just to project my bond with my favourite human: the man I love; to be my husband eternally, with Lilith as our witness.

If she hadn't approached me at all, then I'd really have taken my own life. Although I refused to acknowledge her connection to the recurring "nightmares" until later, I realised after just one week of meditation that she'd made me unable to attempt suicide, by draining my feelings overnight (I had no dreams in those cases). Numerous times I had seriously contemplated it to the point of writing down plans, only to stumble upon the note the next morning and wonder: "Huh? Why did I write something like this?", and casually throw it away as I was completely devoid of emotions for the next few days. A week after I learned to meditate, she let me take back what she once took, and the gaps I'd felt in my memory for a decade were filled. I came to understand myself much better as I processed it all in meditation.

>>33719259 (2/2)
As I mentioned, I'd begun to question my reasoning for being so harsh to her as I realised how much more was possible than I once realised, as long as my perspective is bent a little. Suppose if I'd had a fulfilling spirit relationship, whether with her, or perhaps a dreamy male spirit with many fluffy tails instead. The obvious problem would be me going off the deep end, as I looked down on other humans and felt detached from society. Well, what if it had simply been so fulfilling that there was no malice left in me for me to take out on anyone? Instead, I could make art to express my love even in physical ways.

I don't know if it's just her maddening beauty and strong character, or perhaps my thirst for her abundant energy (as I still refuse to drain as much as I should out of fear of losing myself and harming others), or perhaps some kind of Stockholm syndrome... but lately, I find myself craving her touch. As I find that selfish of me, I find myself thinking I'd like to give her a massage - even a sexual one, if she wanted that. And then I shake my head, thinking I mustn't think things like that. I worry if it's an unwelcome thought, now that I've already decided to marry a human instead; and I could not justify it to my fiancé either.

As I find myself thinking like that, I begin to feel like I hate myself after all again. And then I feel afraid: what if she snaps me out of it like she did before? The last time it happened, I could neither think clearly nor control my emotions. What if I lose sight of what's important to me?

I'm scared... But I don't think that's really her fault. I'm scared of my own feelings.

>Given what happened outside your control, do you think you could have or would have reacted any differently? How would you feel about yourself for reacting that way? From that parallel today, what would you think looking back?
My negative reaction stemmed mainly from feeling emotionally overwhelmed. Having been ostracised by nearly everyone since I was 5 years old, I wasn't mentally ready for that level of intimacy at all back then, regardless of with whom. Conversely, had she been less intense, I wouldn't have taken an interest.

As conflicted as I felt, and even as I cried within those dreams, even as I was traumatised to an extent, I didn't think of them as nightmares at the time. The sensations, her appearance, the way she took control so that I didn't have to feel guilty for giving in, all of it was sublime beyond what I can put into words. Rather, I felt like there must be something wrong with me for reacting so negatively. And indeed, there were many things wrong with me. To put it into perspective, I first started dating my fiancé when I was 18, but the sexual aspects of my relationship with him didn't become enjoyable for me until I was 23.

But I can hardly believe anything is truly impossible after all I've been through. Had I put my mind to it, I believe I could've overcome those things much sooner with her help. And I believe she could've put my mind to it if she wanted to. But she didn't, and I don't blame her. She genuinely seemed to feel hurt by how I reacted, and sometimes we even argued within those dreams. It saddens me to look back on it: how ungrateful I was, and how I later tried to shift the blame for my own problems onto her. I wonder if I should apologise. I wonder if she wants to apologise too, or if it's arrogant of me to even think that...

Had I accepted her back then, I'd look back and feel like she saved me. And then I'd wonder: what if I had chosen *this* life instead?

>Is is possible to ask God to prove himself?
God usually is pretty hands off, all things considered...

>I'll preface that GOD IS NOT A GENIE... Treating him as such isn't the best way to go about faith/spirituality by any means

Though, IME God does have a tendency to answer sincere & unselfish prayers.
The best policy is a give & take of prayer/thankfulness for help/mercy with various things that are occurring in life, conducting such with minimal predetermined expectations.

>I won't lie and say preordained events don't exist though... because they do.
Sometimes events of the past have to occur for future realizations/understandings
God will often give challenges/hinderances so you grow more as a person. (Only after the fact will you realize later that issue was actually beneficial/eye opening)
Sometimes God gently nudges people toward a certain life path/obscure direction to further his own works
God often works through individuals without their inherent knowledge, people rarely realize the impacts they have
Exceedingly rarely he'll drop a world shattering revelation/epiphany on somebody

>TLDR:
IME, Many people can easily ignore God's influence & greatly overly rationalize events/happenings into pure coincidence.
People are often fickle & stubborn, I'd suggest giving a faith based perspective a chance & being thankful for lil' things you often take for granted.

posts.com:
Recognize that you are not your thoughts. You’re correct in your assumption that meditation helps. Focusing on breathing - the involuntary impulse that your body takes care of without your input (which most take for granted) - is the easiest way to shift your focus away from the thoughts that are not you. As thoughts arise, don’t engage with them. Don’t run from them. Sit with them and observe them for what they are. Soon, you will hear a different voice, which has been there all along, whispering as it tries to cut through the noise.

4 or 5 hours may be sufficient sleep for one who is unburdened by stress.

Focus not on what you lack. Focus on what you have, what you’ve done, that you have your breath, a roof. Who do you need to impress? Why? These are thoughts that may pop up that will lead you to the root of your desires. And once you understand them, you will be able to focus on what matters most.

Hold good energy and nurture it. Stoke that flame and let it keep your entire being warm.

Before bed, recap your day in reverse order, mentally, taking note of any major events or coincidences. Go to bed in a state of gratitude. Put yourself there by focusing exclusively on the parts that make you whole, observe what makes you feel less-than, and know that tomorrow is a new day. Set the morning rhythm with the same grace as you stare at the ceiling and breathe. You have a bed. Warmth. You’re thriving. You are not the same person you were yesterday. You will not be the same person at the end of today.

You are not your thoughts. You are not your body. Find out who you are and you will truly be free.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>could it be alcohol related
Any act committed with the intention of escaping the reality in front of you will always be a coping mechanism. Thus, you must engage with reality on your own terms. Define them well.

Don’t drink to escape. Don’t drink in the manner that television teaches you to. Drink to honor the moment. Reframe the experience and learn from it. Which brand do I like best? Dislike? What can I do under the influence that I can’t do sober? Is it better alone or with company? Am I limiting my beliefs or should I strive to maintain a state of openness? How can I receive the inpourings of love if I seal myself in a box?

The energy you hold within you can be defined as an attractor force/pattern. This is an authentic resonance that you emit, that we all pick up on subconsciously, it’s that thing that makes one glow. The essence behind the mask. It cannot fool and does not deceive, it simply is. Thus, to be that which you seek, you, quite literally, must embody that essence. You cannot be authentic if you lie to yourself. Alcohol is never to blame. It starts with you, the one who is as blameless and innocent as the rest of us.

We’re all here to figure it out. You’re doing a fine job. Don’t sweat the small stuff, yeah?

I'm just gonna explain the general philosophy of this, because it's not really specifically about a lover. This is a general "magical" philosophy, which applies to LoA, but you'll come across this if you research other magical practices, religions, and so on. You don't have to apply any of this, but just throwing it out there for anyone that wants to know.

Essentially, your "ego", the reasoning, logical part of your mind is dumb. It has its purpose to interact with the world, but it's also the reason you develop doubts, get led on wild goose chases (seeking and NOT finding), and getting into all sorts of trouble.

You might've learned about the conscious and subconscious minds, but there's another higher form, called the superconscious mind. This mind has a better understanding of your life and what would fulfill you because it sees things from the spirit plane, and thus it gives "perfect" ideas. When you hear about spiritual guidance, that's from the superconscious mind. If you've ever heard of LoA people talking about "inspired action", that's from the superconscious mind. People that seek to be "enlightened" will rely on these kinds of ideas the most, but even without being an LoA master or anything, you'll probably get little "flashes" of these kinds of thoughts anyways.

So when LoA gurus and authors and stuff say to manifest a loving relationship without a particular person you know in mind, this is the reason. Your own experiences are very limited, and leave you blind to the possibility of a much greater relationship, one that can leave you happier than you can currently imagine. In the big picture, what those LoA gurus eventually want people to do is to trust in their higher self for every situation, to live their life with divine intuition.

I was dreaming and I was somewhat half lucid, I was aware of my thoughts during the dream. I was walking around a busy town near the sea during a sunny day and I thought by myself: "all these people here doing their things, talking to each other, walking around, enjoying the weather, etc. in my dream, it is no different than in real life."

I continued to walk by myself until I walked to a balcony on the edge of the city with a view of the sea and the sun, and here I stood still and enjoyed the view of it.

Because I was standing still, I felt that I was shifting out of the dream world, either back to real life or to another dream, I didn't know. But I really didn't want to wake up so I kinda forced myself to stay in that shifting phase which felt like the most deepest medititative state I have ever been in. Without thinking about it, I began to do affirmations. It was like my subconscious knew that this was the state to be in do manifest whatever you want so literally instantly I did my affirmations.

The I Am affirmations I was doing was so insanely powerful in this state I was in that it literally felt that my mind's eye was about to burst open, it was such a strong sensation that I had to stop because it literally felt like it would explode. After this I woke up.

I have no doubts about it. What I affirmed is true because the sensations I felt was out of this world.

For those who doubt about LOA, it is a technique that is different for every person. You have to find out what works for yourself and this takes time, dedication and effort. You want to tailor it so it fits perfectly to you as a person. Those who doubt about it are not putting the work in, which also reflects in other aspects in their lives.

Attention newbies: Neville is not the be-all and end-all teacher. If you tried his ladder experiment and it hasn't worked in three weeks, find another teacher or method, because his ladder experiment was made to test whether it was worth it for him to teach someone or not (if it didn't work in a week, he would straight up tell those people to not bother coming to his next lecture). There are plenty of other straightforward ways that have nothing to do with Neville that people have found success in. For instance:

Brain or CNS inflammation could also cause visual and hearing issues, of course. But then you'd also likely experience occasional but significant visual distortions.

In any case, here's a quick hack if the noise gets on your nerves while you are trying to deal with it: press the palms of your hands against your ears firmly enough to make an airtight seal, then gently tap the back of your head with your fingers a few times. Whoosh, you just found a physical body glitch.

Just a quick note on niacin as part of the maintenance phase. There were concerns over extended and sustained release niacin causing potential side effects. Generally this isn't an issue unless you approach 2g or more per day. SR is the one to avoid, but a standard time release slo niacin is an ER and would be considered safe at the amounts recommended.

I'm going to recap here for new arrivals why the protocol changed and some of the thinking behind it.

Mac and Peribsen decided that it would be more beneficial to go with slo niacin over the previous protocol version, which was Nicotinamide Riboside (NR).

Slo Niacin remains active for far longer in the body and combined with Pterostilbene each dose lasts significantly longer and provides more of a systemic benefit over NR.

HOWEVER. If you are still having concerns over the ER/XR versions, a nicotinamide/niacinamide or NR will also work. It will not remain active in the system for as long as slo niacin but there will still be benefit.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33705047
sit down.
close eyes (personally recommended)
Place tongue gently on roof of mouth.
Focus on the breath going in and out of your nose.
If any kind of sensation/thought/distraction comes up, note it with a simple label (whatever comes first/is natural) and gently return back to the breath.
Don't control anything, just watch your breath going in and out like you were cloud watching.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I've been meditating for years now and yet I can't really put into words what meditation is, I like the "meditation is deliberate focus of awareness" thing that people usually talk about.

Cultivating the ability to focus takes time. Focusing on the breath or a candle are the 2 basic exercises people recommend, it teaches you to "feel" and "observe" which are different from "thinking", it may take months to snap out of the "thinking" mode for just a second but that sole second is enough to show you that your thinking mind is not you nor your reality, it's like a radio which plays all the time and you were living with that radio open for most of your life.

>>33699233
For me the "observer" focus/mode is when you are not a slave to your thoughts and you are calmer thus you don't get dragged away by them, while the "focus" focus is the ability to focus on one thing with all your might, I say that those 2 go hand-in-hand and maybe someone could say that they are the same thing: the ability to take a step back from everything, be calm and direct your focus/observing whatever you want.

Also during my sits I remember how to feel my feelings. Feelings inhabit your body and you can feel them better if you focus on them, they usually carry forgotten memories or various insights and blissful states if you focus on them enough.

Meditation is a paradox to me, it's like a means to an end but also the end itself, it's like a vehicle which takes you places but also it's just erasing all the unnecessary noise around you to realize that all those places were always here next to you.

So sit and watch your breath, feel your body breathing, your mind will make thousands of stories about anything but just let it be, don't even label those thoughts, don't even say "I'm letting them go", just let them be and focus on your breath, on the feeling of your body breathing, your mind will say "that's stupid, analyzing these important things is better", but just focus on the breath.

>>33710828
What you say makes sense but from my own experiences I 'd say that those 2 are the same thing.

Focusing is like an ability, people are good at it or not.

You can be focused on just this moment and your surroundings without being focused on a single object. This is like being totally present, you are focused on the present, your mind isn't wandering outside of your control, thoughts may pop up but they don't take you away in daydreaming (which most people have but don't realize). Imagine that this focusing ability is like a magnifying glass, let's say that what I just described is the point "zero" of the magnifying glass, our basic reality. This is what you called the "observer" mode.

However you can zoom into one single thing using that magnifying glass, say your breath or an object. You can literally move your entire consciousness towards that thing to the point that your awareness travels there, some people say that "wizards/shamans/yogis" can move their entire consciousness towards that object and move it with their will or inhabit the body of an animal, others say that they can zoom their eyesight so much to the point that they look at the atoms of an object, some even say that they hypnotize others through this way. This is the point "1" of the glass.

Conversely you can even zoom out, you can become the whole room and even look at yourself from above, you can become your whole house and the whole city, you can focus on the whole galaxy and the whole cosmos, you can even break the linear time illusion and realize that everything is one single moment which takes place here and now. Let's say that this is the point "-1" of the glass.

That's what meditation is: Realizing that you are everything at the same time, your awareness can go everywhere since you are part of the whole, the ego is an illusion, break free from it and realize that you are whole, ignore your thoughts which most of the time are just the ego talking nonsense.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I used to practice active imagination semi-regularly approximately 3 years ago. I don't practice it anymore, and I have a very good reason for that. Firstly, let's remember that this term (active imagination) originates in C. G. Jung's works.

The primary issue when reading Jung's works is that he never properly defines how to do active imagination. He states what it is, but from the works of his I've read (~7), he never gives enough detail for you to start doing it in a methodological way. And where there's no methodology outlined, how can you say you're doing it as he intended?

The idea is that you are allowing your Unconscious to produce images, symbols, narratives, etc. etc. Those details alone necessitate a specification: How do you know when you're in true contact with the Unconscious or if it's a conscious fantasy by the conscious mind?

Here's what I used to do. I would lay down on my back, and I would engage in a sort of meditation. I would hold a conscious image in mind, and wait for something to happen. What happened is that I began noticing that I would sometimes reflexively produce changes in the images through my conscious mind. In other words, my conscious mind was creating a fantasy. Now, thankfully, I had enough self-awareness to catch myself doing this during the process. I disregarded it as contact with the Unconscious. If it were truly from the Unconscious, then what would happen will catch the conscious mind off guard. I would right down the transformations in the images, but I never had an "amazing insights."

The most important thing, if you're going to do it, is to develop the mindfulness to know whether or not it's legit versus just a conscious fantasy. The conscious mind has all sorts of ways of deceiving itself, and it's important we're not fooled by those things.

Nowadays, I have dispensed with active imagination as I used to do it and only do self-hypnosis. Self-hypnosis is amazing if done properly.

Another fun simple excercise I find helpful for both children and adults is based off an old show called Mr Squiggle I loved as a kid (the man from the moon heh).

All you need is a pen (preferably two tho with diff colours) and paper. Pick one colour and close your eyes and draw a few random squiggles on the paper. It just means that we should try our best to recognize our own biases and be open to other perspectives in our pursuit of the sacred.

His act is worse (symbolically considered) than any rape or dynamite outrage. For it destroys all buildings: it insults all women. The thief is satisfied with diamonds; but the suicide is not: that is his crime. He cannot be bribed, even by the blazing stones of the Celestial City. The thief compliments the things he steals, if not the owner of them. But the suicide insults everything on earth by not stealing it. He defiles every flower by refusing to live for its sake. There is not a tiny creature in the cosmos at whom his death is not a sneer. When a man hangs himself on a tree, the leaves might fall off in anger and the birds fly away in fury: for each has received a personal affront. Of course there may be pathetic emotional excuses for the act. There often are for rape, and there almost always are for dynamite. But if it comes to clear ideas and the intelligent meaning of things, then there is much more rational and philosophic truth in the burial at the cross-roads and the stake driven through the body, than in Mr. Archer’s suicidal automatic machines. There is a meaning in burying the suicide apart. The man’s crime is different from other crimes—for it makes even crimes impossible.
~G. K. Chesterton

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

>2.)
That's sleep paralysis followed by HH. Your body fell asleep while your mind was awake so it layered dream hallucinations on top of it.
>The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe
Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

is thinking while sleeping linked to lucid dreaming?

it's a form cognitive processing that resembles rumination and autistic problem-solving mental language, that happens while sleeping. i usually wake up still remembering what i was thinking about, and oftentimes i remember conclusions i reached far before i woke up, while using this way of thinking.

the other day it got more weird though. i caught myself (became one extra layer of lucid, sort of) thinking about Baudrillard's Simulation and Simulacra and i saw that i could release control of the train of thought with it still functioning. i tried to shift my consciousness back upon myself to hopefully identify the source of this thinking, but to no avail.
i then thought: "what if I don't snap out of it and wake up like i usually do, rather what if i were to speed the train of thought?"
well i managed to speed it up, and words soon became fast moving concepts, symbols and images, like fast forwarding a movie reel. there was a constant sense of direction of where the thoughts were going, and it felt like a straight road ahead, or a laser filled with thoughts that shot onwards into infinity.

it started moving so fast i couldn't control and/or understand it anymore, so when i decided to let go of it, it snapped off of the point of creation within myself. i watched the last thought i had go away into a fixed point on the horizon of the darkness of my closed eyes, and i was left in the most peaceful silence and the widest, emptiest and cleanest headspace i had in months.
when i woke up, I felt like i could keep this clear headspace if i focused on maintaining all mental conditions like they were back then, but unfortunately the internal chatter returned in 30 minutes of so when i opened my laptop to catch up on some emails.

anybody experienced something similar before, or tried to produce something similar?
or anyone has some resources i could look into?

>>33686943
1. Get on a good sleep schedule, 8 hours a night.
2. When you awake from a dream, lay still and do not move. Focus all your energy on remembering every detail of the dream.
3. Write down the dreams in a way you feel comfortable that will allow you to identify common themes.
4. Pay attention to these commons themes and try to find waking similarities to them.
5. Develop reality checks based off of those similarities. Make it become second nature/muscle memory to constantly check to see if you're dreaming based off of those dream/reality similarities.
6. You will begin to notice these things in your dreams and will start to question if you are dreaming while you are in fact dreaming.
7. Once you realize you are fully conscious while you are dreaming, remain calm. Spin in place and perform simple tasks with your mind to solidify your lucidity in your dream. (Turn lights off and on, move small objects, try to read text or clocks, etc)
8. Remain calm. Spin in place again if you have to. Later you can use this practice to change your dream setting.
9. Go slowly. Do not immediately try to materialize a girl to have sex with or fly or whatever your wildest fantasy you want to act out is. Be consistent with all steps even after you begin to frequently achieve lucidity.
10. Learn to flow with the dreams while controlling them with subtlety. Enjoy them, learn from them. Learn from the people you can speak with. Learn ways to go further, deeper. Don't overthink or over analyze.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33687689
>how long does all this take?
That depends entirely on your commitment to keeping a dream journal. A lot of people, especially 99% of the total faggots that frequent /x/ now, will say this is gay and stupid. These people have no, do not and will never become lucid in a dream. The dream journal is possibly the most important practice to keep to become a consistent lucid dreamer. It's perhaps more important than maintaining a good sleep schedule to allow your brain to get into those good sleep cycles. You absolutely must focus and remember your dreams in as much detail as you can in order to find the common themes and instances that can help you trigger reality checks which will result in you becoming lucid.
You can get an app, or just keep a notebook next to your bed; whatever.
>what do i write down?
First, just focus on the dream. The smallest amount of movement or other thoughts will fire neurons in your brain and immediately make you start forgetting the dream. Even opening your eyes while lying still is enough to make your brain fire and forget. Just lay still and replay the dream and burn it into your memory. As much detail as possible. Then, write it down. It will take some time to build up a good library of dreams before you can start noticing common themes and weird instances you can use as trigger points for reality checks.

posts.com:
Here's a logical explanation:
29.5 days in the lunar cycle (phases of the moon)
365.24 days in a year
365.24/29.5 = 12.38 lunar cycles in a year
1000/12.38 = 80.77 years a person would have lived if they lived 1000 lunar cycles
They measured age by lunar cycles back then. And they called cycles of the moon years.

It's a misconception that Capricorn cares about social status.

Capricorn doesn't want to be a loser and wants to be recognized roughly proportional to its accomplishments but also respectability of character. That isn't enneatype 3 / Leo craving for praise---it's the expectation of input/output.

Also, Capricorn doesn't care about "career"; it cares about "mission" if anything: the goal, the purpose, the endgame. Capricorn doesn't identify with their job, they identify with their skillset and capabilities. Everything is internalized with Capricorn, with the sole exception of the change to the world they set out to make.

Career and social status is of no consequence to Capricorn. That's just the misinterpretation that small-minded observers have assigned to it and the 10th house.

Moon = your inner self

Midheaven (mc) = beginning of 10th house = best career, legacy, public image
Chiron = wound, area of life you struggle with
Triangles = trines = good
Squares = bad
Circle and line = conjunction = good
Two circles and line = opposition = bad
Star made of three lines = sextile = good
These are some basics.

Hey anon, I'm picking up what you're putting down. The notion of forsaking pleasure, comfort etc as spiritual discipline is known as 'tapas,' literally 'heat' in Sanskrit. As praxis, it's called 'tapasya,' 'generating heat.'
Hindu ascetics are known as sannyasin, that's a good starting point for learning about the philosophical aspect of ascetic practice and how it relates to scripture in Hinduism.
https://www.britannica.com/topic/sannyasi
https://ocoy.org/dharma-for-christians/bhagavad-gita-for-awakening/tapasya-and-the-three-gunas/ (despite ostensibly being a Christian monastery those folks write really good articles on a lot of topics pertaining to yogic practice)
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapas_(Indian_religions)

My internet connection's being a dick right now but I'm pretty sure this is a collection of the sannyasa upanishads, the 17 upanishads dealing with ascetic practice-- https://archive.org/details/SamnyasaUpanishads
Either way, if that's not a good source you'll find some good info by researching the terms above l. Just be aware that Osho cultists are called sannyasins, which is complete shit as they actively celebrate degeneracy, so search results can be coloured with bullshit about Osho at times.
All the best anon, there's a lot of power and, paradoxically, joy in ascetic practice. Not that I'm particularly good at it, but those times I'm flowing and content with little are vastly superior to times of perceived scarcity.

posts.com: I'm not certain about the definition in a Christian context, but Aristotle used this concept a lot. Baiscally, prima materia is matter but abstract, because it has no form (i.e. essence, or specificities). It cannot exist by itself because it's only the second term in things (essence/substance). It's the passive principle which contains virtually every material possibility, but which has to be "opened up".

Like I said last thread, Socrates' conception of the Daimon was relatively common either contemporary to him or as an immediate consequence of his influence. We can debate how precisely it arose but again Daimon was a relatively common idea.

I strongly recommend looking at the wiki pages for Daimon and more specifically Genius and how the concept slots into Helleno-Roman culture. I'd be very reluctant to ascribe either the totality of Socrates' doctrines with contemporary ideas of the HGA or even that like his implied relations were without any kind of religious ceremony or veneration - that's just information that's not even remotely in evidence so I see no reason to speculate too much on whether or not there was a rite attached to his interface.

I very sincerely feel like you're drawing too many threads and extrapolating too many conclusions from not enough data.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
https://vimeo.com/563950668

Two perspectives: one focused inwardly at an object (analysis) and one focused outwardly at the environment. (synthesis.) A crystal as an object is "a highly ordered microscopic structure, forming a crystal lattice that extends in all directions," while the *process* of crystallization is the taking-in of the environmental conditions by the emerging object that nourishes and influences the growth of the crystal.

"Everything that in any sense exists has two sides, namely, its individual self and its signification in the universe.” These two poles cannot be torn apart. Each finds its fulfillment in the other via their dialectical relation. Thus, becoming is for the purpose of being (signification in the universe) and being is for the purpose of novel becoming (the emergent individual self.)... The entire world finds its place in the internal constitution of the new creature, and the new creature lays an obligation upon the future: that it take into account the value achieved by the new creature. Thus every creature both houses and pervades the world" - Elizabeth Kraus, "The Metaphysics of Experience."

Mindfulness Meditation is about just taking in changing environmental conditions without the goal of trying to change them, while Perception Bending ( pastebin.com/vHKeTau2 ) is concentrative meditation, with the goal of changing one's perception.

Imagine this as not a card, but a rule that players start with. Cooperative players can keep track of their mana-generation rate and compare them to other cooperative game-players. So it's coopetition. The meta-goal of this coopetition would be to find the best cooperative mana-generating libraries possible in the game, so the meta-game is fundamentally cooperative. Everyone shares strategies and library compositions because everyone wants to find the best libraries. But as Magic: the Gathering is constantly coming out with new cards, strategies and libraries have to continually evolve.

I had taken 6g of purple mystic and had a somewhat bad trip. As soon as I did this, it was as if the trip instantly turned off. The visuals, the mindfuck head space, the body load, all of it was instantly gone.

It was as if all my sensory input had either been replaced or maybe simply removed, revealing what the senses hide? I don't know
All I could perceive was a pale golden light and a steady drone. It didn't feel anything like what people describe as ego death, and I didn't feel the presence of any entities, loving or otherwise. I just felt a profound sense of peace and calm joy. Words fail me beyond this much. It was just so strange.

At some point (my sense of time was impossible to describe) I decided to "return to reality" and the trip resumed immediately, as if my awareness had been somewhere else and had just returned to my body as soon as I willed it. Many different books and philosophies have been written saying different things.
Probably something like, if you are a person who did a lot of good deeds, you have merit to go to a pleasurable heaven, and if you worshipped a god you have merit to go to the heaven corresponding to that god. But eventually the merit wears off and you are forced to reincarnate on the earth.

This will sound stupid as I am not a regular and I apologize if it is, but I was playing a game (SMT Nocturne) and a character recited a chant to the tune of "El Elohim El Eloho El Shaddai El Adonai" and so on with more names attached, hitting some names I recognized and some I did not, but interpreted from the context as a combination of synonyms for "God," and a magical rite or chant or spell. Cursory research seems to imply that while everyone in the 21st century agrees the "names" are just synonyms for just "God," there seems to be enough contextual clues that "El" is the nomenclature for "Godly Class" that "Shaaddai, Eloho, Elohim, Tetragrammaton, et. al." belong to, with me being able to find a couple translations such as Tetragrammaton/Yahweh being the favored God of Israel (Isra El?) and Eloho being something like "that God in the mountains." Whether that's a good translation is not for me to say because I unfortunately have to rely on interpretations of interpretations.

Further research showed me that mystics (specifically Aleister Crowley) believe this long string of "God names" (IIRC passed down IRL through the Greek Magical Papyri or some other Chaldean oral tradition leading to Kabbalah, there was no hard answer here) to simply be nonsense, but powerful nonsense, which he couldn't necessarily translate but insisted it didn't matter because the words themselves had power and not necessarily the intention or knowledge of them.

Is there a better understanding to be had here or have I pretty much hit the bottom of what can be gleaned in regards to so old a concept? Were these actual magic words or were they names used to invoke actual magic Gods' favors?

I recommend following up by reading Jake Stratton Kent's thoughts on the GMP while remembering that the man could occasionally be wrong. Otherwise, the only other place you can go to figure out what the truth is, is by starting to experiment with the GMP itself.

>Is this spirituality, or delusion?
You will have to come to terms with being unable to ever answer this to complete satisfaction. At some point, asking this question does not make sense. If you want to further philosophize about this you should read Nagarjuna. That is not to say that asking the question is meaningless, it's just that it's relative. Evaluating possible delusion is useful when actions or dispositions have the possibility to be harmful to your life or the lives of others, grounding yourself in """"reality""" is not unwise. But Truth lies both in and beyond our anthropocentric epistemological limitations.

>>33716119

From the paper:

>For Gare, as will be shown, it is Aristotle’s concepts of causation, (Leclerc’s fourfold determination), together with the notions of becoming, potentiality, actuality and energeia that help underpin a metaphysics that accounts for a partially self-causing relational order in the universe, one that is in process of becoming. For mechanistic science, however, it was a different matter. In agreeing with Aristotle that a primary physical existent must be a unitary entity, rather than composite, the discovery, particularly in medicine with Sebastian Basso, that human bodies are composite, led mechanistic thought at the time to conclude that human beings could not be primary physical existents. Rather, the primary physical existents are their most elemental components. This led to atomism and the consequent return to Neoplatonism in which reality was reduced to the divinely caused, mathematically abstract motion of inert, indivisible and immutable atoms. Matter was thus separated from what had been its Aristotelian correlate, form, and given primary ontological status, at the same time denying natural existents any immanent capacity for ‘kinesis’. As Leclerc argues, this formed the basis of modern physics as mechanism, rather than organism, and established motion, like space and time, as ontologically distinct, rather than as derivative.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33716195
>Members attempt "to preserve and strengthen" their "isolate, psyche-centric existence" through adherence to the left-hand path.

This is a variant of what I call "the cocoon fallacy," the notion that minds are fundamentally detached from each other internally, and only bouncing off of each other.

Whitehead integrates this with the right hand path:

>Everything that in any sense exists has two sides, namely, its individual self and its signification in the universe.” These two poles cannot be torn apart. Each finds its fulfillment in the other via their dialectical relation. Thus, becoming is for the purpose of being (signification in the universe) and being is for the purpose of novel becoming (the emergent individual self.)... The entire world finds its place in the internal constitution of the new creature, and the new creature lays an obligation upon the future: that it take into account the value achieved by the new creature. Thus every creature both houses and pervades the world - Elizabeth Kraus, The Metaphysics of Experience: A Companion to Whitehead's Process and Reality.

>overcome or come to grips with the way you are fucked personally?
Um, sort of.
So we can think of the Klipot, the Shells, as "secretions" of the Sefira. So this is actually like an eggshell - as you're practicing you're also hemming yourself in and creating arbitrary boundaries. The power in this shit comes in breaking all that stuff. So while the Sefira and the Shells might be like actually universal (this is questionable but run with me) HOW THE INTERACT WITH YOU AND YOU INTERACT WITH THEM is going to be like bound to your immediate circumstances: Mindstate, physical location, actual history.

In other words, being a lazy piece of shit might be universal but the reason YOU are a lazy piece of shit is like inexorably linked to your context.

posts.name: fix

>>33718571

This is meant for foundational instruction/knowledge. Thoughts?
~
The following titles will give a very solid foundation in western, Hellenistic to medieval, astrology:
Carmen Astrologicum, Dorotheus of Sidon (c 1st century CE Greek), Translated by David Pingree.
Ben Dykes also has a translation of Carmen Astrologicum the Umar al-Tabari translation.
Firmicus Maternus, Matheseos Libri VIII, (Theory and Practice of Astrology in 8 books) (c 4th Century CE Roman) translated by Jean Rhys Bram. https://www.astrologiahumana.com/firmicusmaternustheoryandpractice.pdf
Vettius Valens, Anthologies. (c150 CE Greco-Roman) There is a very good free PDF of Mark Rileys translation here https://www.csus.edu/indiv/r/rileymt/Vettius%20Valens%20entire.pdf And a better formatted edition here https://beyondtheheaven.wordpress.com/2019/02/12/vettius-valens-anthologies-new-edition-of-rileys-translation/
Introductions to Traditional Astrology, Abu Ma'shar & al-Qabishi, (c 9-10th century CE Arabic)Translated & edited by Ben Dykes.
Works of Sahl & Masha'allah, (c 8-9th century CE Arabic) Translated by Ben Dykes.
For some things written in this millennium, there is Hellenistic Astrology the study of Fate and Fortune, by Chris Brennan.
And, Benjaman Dykes, Traditional Astrology for Today, An Introduction.
To make things easier start with Ben Dykes Traditional Astrology for Today, and after you have some understanding of the basics read Chris Brennan, then advance to the other titles listed.
For Indian, "Vedic" astrology, the source text is the Brihat Parasara Hora Sastra. Most all other vedic texts are abstracts from this. See the books of Freedom Cole for a modern, and easier to read, perspective.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Good to see a varied and realistic bunch of perspectives here. This topic usually devolves real fuckin' quick-- I'm at the same stage as a lot of people who've posted so far. Smoked dope full-time for 15-17 years, got a lot of benefit out of it but my mind ultimately revolted against it and I started feeling gross, sweaty and paranoid when high.
Initially had incredibly spiritual experiences but with time and increasing potency I think I started having more manic/mild psychotic episodes over the last few years I was smoking daily .

On a spiritual level, I think it was good to me up to a certain point- showed me where to concentrate on chakras/meridians etc, demonstrated that shakti/prana/qi is very real and can be directly observed, and facilitated deep focus/trance states. Once I was established in that though, it started kicking my arse repeatedly until I just had to stop. I fried my mind so hard it's taken two years to be able to meditate again, but now I'm just starting to feel those samadhi states and energetic sensations again.
It's like I've come full circle and now I have to learn these skills again in a different context.
Overall, 10/10 and I recommend it unless you're predisposed to schizophrenia, but it's advisable to hang up the phone once the message has been received. At best you'll just become a boring cunt repeating the same stories constantly and doing nothing all the time, at worst you could potentially lose your shit for real, particularly if doing energy work.

The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664746
It wasn't until 387,000 B.C. that the Lyrans once again had an effect on Earth. Another war had ravaged Lyra, and many of those on the losing side had fled for safety. They travelled through the cosmos and came to Earth as a place of sanctuary.
It was peaceful here; the local humans were primitive and offered no resistance to their high technology. It was decided they would stay and build a colony.

Back home in Lyra it was discovered that a large group had fled to Earth, and ships were dispatched to come after them. Upon arriving at Earth they were disgusted and appalled to find the conditions that prevailed here. The local Earth-humans were being used as slaves and were being mistreated badly. Many were being used in experiments where they were being mated with animals, while others were being disfigured, raped, or maimed.
The colony was an example of the darkest side of man. Living in degeneration and filth, it was decided to leave the colony on Earth, take away all of their technology, including their space ships, and leave the 144,207 Lyran soldiers to their own fate on Earth.

This colony died out after several thousand years, and the spirits of the Lyran soldiers that were left behind became part of the spirit world of Earth. The 144,207 degenerate Lyran soldiers would now be incarnating here along with the original inhabitants.

The effect they would have on Earth would forever steer it away from a normal evolution.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664910
Lyran history continued to repeat itself for thousands of years until, after restoring themselves once again to a high level of technology; they built flight machines with beamdrives and once again moved out into the cosmos. Their leaders were great scientists with an understanding of spiritual power, so once again they began to conquer other races. Their leaders soon realized the unlimited powers of the spiritual forces and developed them until they became masters of these great forces, becoming known as an ISHWISH (IHWH), meaning "god" or "king of wisdom."
The great power of their spirit allowed them to live for thousands of years, and they ruled over countless civilizations.

The Ishwish leaders ruled with cruel power, and eventually the public started a civil uprising. The war lasted for almost four centuries, causing the death of more than 60% of the population and nearly destroying the three worlds of the Lyra system. It seemed that no one in the Lyra systems would escape this slaughter that raged 230,000 years ago.

An Ishwish named Asael could see the end coming and fled from the wars with 360,000 people in 183 great spaceships, capable of transporting over a thousand passengers each, and 250 small space reconnaissance ships that could carry a crew of three. This group of Lyrans wandered through space for many years until they came across a star system with 254 still young, blue suns. There were already a few colonized planets with primitive people living there, but they were no threat to the great Lyran technology. They landed and built their new society on three different planets around a star they called Taygeta.
Life was hard and difficult, and it took 300 years or their civilization to grow and adapt to their new environment.

Millions of Lyrans fled the great wars and settled in Orion, Hyades and the Pleiades.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664930
After the new civilization developed, Asael commanded that they start to explore and conquer other worlds again, just as they had done in Lyra.
The powerful beamdrive ships sped out into open space and once main established a reign of tyranny over planets of less-developed beings and brought them under their control. It was during this time that they came into the system known as the Hesperides.

A young, underdeveloped form of human life was there and was quickly conquered and fell under Asael's ruler ship.
The Lyrans once again were exercising their power over others and beginning to force their rule throughout the galaxy. It seems that the forces of greed and power were inbred well into the Lyrans, considering that peace seemed to escape them time after time.
There had been millions of years of bloodshed and wars, and still they had not learned to get along peacefully with other races.

The Ancient Lyrians split off to Orion, Hyades, and the Pleiades and started new colonies.
The planets of the Pleiades soon flourished and spread out to Earth, Mars, Hesperides, and Milona.

Seventy years of conquering had diminished Asael's lust for power, and his life of bloodthirsty rule came to an end as the father of the Pleiades passed away. Control of the new race of the Pleiades fell to his daughter Pleja, an Ishrish, (the female form of an Ishwish) who, like her father, had the blood of a warrior.

Eager to build their great society even farther, the ordered the exploration ships to again seek out new worlds that could fall under her rule.
As the ships moved out into space once again to explore, they came across the trail of the Destroyer Comet which so many years ago had been the destructive force that had ended the Lyran Empire. Contained within the tail of the great comet, they discovered debris from the planets of ancient Lyra.

It was decided to follow the comet for awhile and study its path of violence.

This was the destructive force that had changed the history of Lyra and caused death on thousands of worlds, and now it had brought the warriors from the Pleiades into a small sun system and the home of a little planet called Earth.

To their surprise, they discovered a small group of uncivilized people living there. Some were brown-skinned and could be traced to the origin of life on Earth. Others were of mixed color, but most were white-skinned and had a Lyran spirit-form. The Pleiadians had stumbled onto a colony founded by their ancient Lyran ancestors who had degenerated into a primitive society. Awed by their discovery of human life and common ancestry, it was decided to colonize three different planets in the system and continue the family chain. News of their discovery was sent back to the home planets and apparently sparked an interest in Pleja, for she ordered a great migration to be undertaken. Within a very short time thousands of travelers from tie Pleiades came and created societies on Earth, Mars, and Milona.
Milona was a planet which existed beyond the orbit of Mars at that time.

It was only a few short years before a small war raged on Earth, and many of the scientists left to return to the Pleiades, leaving the three planets to grow on their own.

Pleja was unhappy with this and did not want her new colonies to be destroyed, so she dispatched a fleet to stop the war, and things calmed down again.

>>33715051
There's basically two broad concepts which really don't overlap; on one hand, the original conception of the Oni was just a form of ogres/giants/wildman, with the great strength, cannibalistic urges and magical powers appropriate for that role. Really, it's almost easier to just compare the role Oni had in traditional Japanese culture with the role similar entities have in mythologies with a similar amount of documentation; specifically, like the traditional celtic and nordic conceptions of similar creatures; in the grand scheme of things, Oni have more in common with nordic Trolls than differences. However, there's also the supernatural conception of the oni, one which is firmly associated with Japanese Buddhism more than Shintoism. Oni are basically integrated into japanese Buddhism as entities which torment people in the afterlife as servants of Enma, the King of the Underworld.

They would need to be cleared for that information and thus all of the legal ramifications for unlawfully districuting classified documents would be applied normally.

skinnybob.info:
Isn't this obviously fake?
After extensive investigation and observation of people's reaction we can tell you that if it is fake, it is certainly not "obviously" so. Usually people judge based on superficial, personal opinions formed after a glance at the two skinny Bob closeups, accounting for only 29% of the entire material. CG being ubiquitous in motion picture productions nowadays also causes people to have a distorted view on what it takes in terms of effort, time and money to create such a hoax. The reason some propose authenticity is a combination of supporting aspects and the lack of direct evidence for fabrication.

Wasn't the material debunked with the discovery of post-processing effects and overlays?
No, because what matters is the underlying footage the effects and overlays were applied to. Video editing software allows effects to be applied by drag&drop within seconds, whereas the creation of the footage is a completely different category in terms of effort, time and money. No matter if hoax or real, in both cases it seems unlikely the same person(s) responsible for producing the footage also decided to slap cheap stock effects on the video track to finalize their precious work. We assume this decision was made by someone else in the chain. See the discussion about possible motivations above.

skinnybob.info:
A vertical pan seems unlikely due to the total lack of parallax in the original clip. Additionally, there is perfectly smooth linear motion that is hard to achieve by manually raising or lowering a camera without a guiding rail of some sort.

A camera pivoting on a tripod as in (G) is our primary guess but unlike the original video filling the frame with the alien and stadiometer stand on the very left, this demonstration has it centered. The stadiometer apparently remaining straight, suggests (G) to conclusively show it could have been filmed this way. However, the door frame being at the image border (where originally the stadiometer stand is) does get skewed.

A different theory claims that Skinny Bob was filmed as a whole and the body scan scene generated by means of analog or digital post-processing. The final shaking of the camera suggests something analog going on.

You don't need to start with DMT, something more gentle can be of more use in the beginning, i never did DMT, so i'm not going to talk about it, i don't have a background with DMT.

WITH MUSHROOMS, however, i have some experience.
Just to give some context i was on the verge of killing myself last year and i discovered magic mushrooms. After some research (2-3 months thinking about them) i had my first experience with 2grams, and that changed my whole view and also started a journey on self discovery that's lasting even now.
So, my honest advice is to start with magic mushrooms, 2g will do the first trick, then you can use some time to think about what happened with you and go with 3g next time, 4g, 5g and 6g.
Keep in mind that each trip will be crazier than the previous and each one is preparing you for the next.
THEY WILL NOT CHANGE YOU, but they are the KEY to provide the chance, the chance for you to see your issues, problems and all the shit from the root so you can work on them later.
You'll learn to be honest with yourself and to truly see what can and what cannot affect you, because while in the deep states of the mushroom headspace, all the problems of the world have no value and all that permeates is infinite love. You'll see and feel things you forgot that existed, but in levels you could never imagine.

With care, anon.

>>33708310
In my somewhat limited experience of using DMT, I've found that it isn't really a good choice for treating anxiety. I have used vaporized DMT maybe 2 dozen times at what is considered medium doses and I haven't been able to get the "breakthrough" experiences that others describe, it's mostly very weird and hard to remember with little to no lasting psychological effects. I would describe my DMT trips like small fragments of a mushroom trip taken out of context. On that note, psilocybin mushrooms have been a very effective medicine for anxiety. The chances of getting in some clinical trial are pretty small. I would recommend talking with whoever your living with and seeing if they would be cool with you growing some mushrooms. You can find all the info you need on shroomery, youtube, etc. Good luck.

I also want to add: If you can't use these substances in a safe way in your current living situation, don't use them. Better to wait until you can use them properly. 'Set and setting' are some of the primary things to consider with this class of drugs. The drugs are not essential for your development, they are just tools, means to an end. This class of drugs seems to reliably invoke mystical experiences, but they are not required for mystical experiences. You can also work towards that end by studying philosophy, and more importantly putting what you learn to action.

During that time, I also remember recurring dreams of floating up, hitting a "grid" of sorts, and getting slapped down by a malevolent force. It would persist for 1999-2002.

Dreams seemed normal from 2002-2008. I would discover the internet around that period, and immediately fall into schizo stuff. whale.to was one of the first 50 sites I've explored. I was preoccupied with the idea of telepathy for some reason. Ended up learning third eye meditations by accident.

2008-2012 was relearning the stuff from 1999-2002. Many nightmares, many groundhog day loop dreams. Despite the torment I kept going, because I didn't really know I had an option to quit. Eventually transitioned to dreams of beings not of this world. Many good and bad beings.

2012-2020, forgot about all of that, hated college and all the degeneracy, constantly sick from filthy roommates, got out penniless and with nothing to show for it but $16k in debt. End up taking contracted job for the same money out of financial need.

2020-2021 lockdowns happen, Hemi-Sync catches my attention. Lots of it matches my experience. I remember some characters that were good to me. I want to meet them again. Hemi-Sync works on the first go. I did not get to meet those past characters again. Meet about a dozen characters I do not recognize that act like "guides". They seem well intentioned.

2021-2022 I try to go out on my own. Meet new beings. Question the motives of "guides", they don't seem to be open about their intentions and stay in the background. Continue to venture out on my own. A lion-like figure seems to be adamant about teaching me about taking agency into my own hands. The "sins" of mankind are attachments to material world, not the religious sins, which have their utility in the worlds beyond. These new type of characters are very insistent that I learn how to be independent so I can be strong enough to fend off the predatory who prey on the weak, to no longer fear the strong and overcome them.

posts.com:
names do not arrive by mere convention.
each name reflects the nature of its object, the thing named--just as the painting reflects the object painted. Each letter, and each syllable in conjunction and in its permutation expresses its object. This is the principle behind naming. However, any particular name in any given through the ignorance of the name-giver may be inaccurate respecting the object. Names which are perfectly good and accurate respecting their objects can also mutate and corrupt with the passing of time.
The difference between name and object is clear in the world of Time and mutation. However, there are secret names of things intelligible (noetic) or intellectual (noeric) which "are" the very things they name. The name and the being are one and the same. At the very moment the name is spoken, you are in immediate contact with the being. This is the principle behind "magic words" and "divine names" used by magician and theurgist through the millennia.

>>33714546
The line is how you let those entities exert control over you. Ultimately you are your own autonomous being with free will. Angels, demons, spirit animals, what have you are no better nor worse than you or any other human despite their divine, ethereal nature. Let them serve as guides and guides alone. If at any time you find yourself getting overly devoted to the point of losing your sense of calm, groundedness, inner peace, etc. then you need to reevaluate. Same goes for the constant look out for signs. The problem is not how those signs are received or interpreted, for indeed that is how spirit communicate with us at times. Rather, the inability to humbly accept, receive and interpret the information for your own benefit is what causes undue mental, psychotic duress.

posts.name: The Ape of

>>33716143
So someone deep in fey practice has been talking with me for a few years now and it seems like the consensus between historical literature and really earnest practitioners is that these entities are hyperlocal. As in, the Elfheim that you contact at the bend in the river is different from the one at the confluence and the differences as wide as whole ass cosmologies can differ from one tree to the next on our side of things.

Also they aren't, like, spirits. I mean - they are but they behave much more like an extant independent being than like a spirit in the rest of a lot of other systems. You can be HARSHLY pushed aside or shown the door even if nominally doing everything more-or-less right.

I have no good tech for facilitating experience with them but I can advise that you keep an eye out about how nature spirits in your practice area move because they're gonna run along the same, uh, "highways" for lack of a better term. Like, maybe the ley of an area is significant here as a point of overlap between "nature spirits" and "fey".

>>33716143
Elves are Germanic ancestor spirits.
‘Fae’ in the sense you’re thinking of seems to be a term for Celtic supernatural beings.
Gnomes as far as I can tell are a sort of joke, relatively modern invention in the way we think of them but based on old Roman earth spirits.

Past that I can’t tell you much, but looking into the origins and subdivision of such a broad term is helpful. An elf, a faerie and a gnome are all distinct and wildly different in that sense.

>>33707302
I'm a Luciferian and know him decently well.

Is there a difference between the demons and Lucifer and the Devil? That's a very complicated question.

You have to understand that most of the main demons listed in Grimoires originated as pagan deities whose identities were demonized / Stygian-tized (as entities of the underworld) with the spread of Judaism, Islam, and Christianity.

As such, a lot of these deities can put on different cultural masks to fit the worldview or the mythology that the practitioner has chosen to engage in.

For example, the Goddess Aphrodite is identical with the Demon Astaroth. Astaroth was a demonization of the Near Eastern deity Astarte, who was literally that culture's version of Aphrodite; they have a shared historical origin.

Things get complicated with syncretism. Although the substance of their identity as deities most often remain in tact in different cultures, syncretism often results in those masks taking on the characteristics of other deities / myths.

Lucifer started as the Indo-European morning star deity way, way before Christianity, associated with the Planet Venus; for the Planet Venus was mythologically thought to bring in the light of the day and exile the darkness of night. As such, Lucifer has always been associated with the deity who brings knowledge and enlightenment to mankind (hence his role as the serpent in Genesis 1 and his role as Azazel in the Book of Enoch).

(Page 1)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33707302

His most crystalized form as Lucifer as the deity whom we know him as was in the form of the Greek deity Phanes (whose name in Greek literally means Lucifer but "light" as in an enlightenment sense), who was the Supreme God of the Orphics - an ascetic but spiritually epicurean sect that sought social responsibility and kindness to all beings, but still sought refined sensual experiences as the highest goal of life. They identified Phanes with Dionysius, the Greek God of wine drinking, music, and eroticism, and saw him as the creator deity - they saw the fire of human desire that moves civilization forward as the spark of the divine itself. They also connected Phanes to that Morning Star God who brought enlightenment from the heavens.

The Mithraics stole a lot from the Orphics.

The Christians were in direct competition with both the Orphics and Mithraics in Rome as a "mystery school" sect and one for the time being, and part of their propaganda was demonizing the deity Phanes as Satan. They identified Phanes as Satan by reference to Isaiah 14, because they saw the same name "Lucifer" in that verse and connected it to that sect; "Hey you, you claim that Phanes is the Supreme Deity, but it says here in our magical book that Lucifer (Helel / Phanes) is actually Satan who wanted to overthrow God! You are worshipping the Devil!"

For that reason Lucifer became crystalized as Satan in Christianity.

So Satan, as part of the Judeo-Christian mythos, is synonymous with Lucifer if you choose to work through that cultural system.

But Satan standing alone has different origins than Lucifer. In Judaism, he originates as the Archangel Samael and based on what we know of Jewish mysticism, is likely connected more to the Greco-Roman god Ares / Mars than Dionysius. Most Satanists tend to identify more with Samael as a figure more than Lucifer when they refer to "Satan"

As such, they are separate entities, but they are heavily connected to one another.

(Page 2)/

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33714543
Most "Satanists" when they use the name Satan tend to connect more with the Archangel Samael as he exists in Judaism, interpreting him as the warrior angel, the destroyer angel, and the temptor angel. They don't tend to connect it to the Morning Star deity as explicitly or often.

However, with that said, the Archangel Samael is a necessary part of Lucifer's identity now, as he has taken mythology from Samael and applied it to the Judeo-Christian cultural mask.

As a remarkable fact, much of the Orphic sect's beliefs have been preserved in Witchcraft throughout medieval Europe, probably as curious people wanted to study the origins of Lucifer and found out about the Orphics, reconstructing that system; that's why Witchcraft, with it's black masses, orgies, and wine-drinking is connected to Dionysius; it's a recreation of the Ancient Orphic Sect, but applied now through a new cultural mask that works within Judeo-Christian mythology (probably with the influence of Lucifer).

Lucifer as a figure tends to be more affiliated with Witchcraft, as such, than outright Death Metal Satanism.

But the two are intimately connected.

posts.com:
When in great pain, being yourself sometimes comes at the price of connection.

Especially the greater the pain, the more lenient you must be in your expression of it and its truthfulness, as it hurts all people in their own way, real pain. You too.

Honoring yourself is definitely crucial at certain times, poignantly so in others - it does not imply a necessity that is daily, nor weekly for that matter - in fact, when it is at said times, I would say “you’re trying to be yourself by being more than yourself.”

What does that mean?
Well, we all have a core, a central set, matrix - a compilation of information - to enhance our way of acting, in terms of who we are. The greater the pain we experience, the more potential we have to empower others' negativity.
That means, to literally hold yourself back; to not express your great pain; you are innately doing the bare minimum service of being civilized and morally dignified.
It is not incessantly a duty, yet in desire it becomes so.
You choose to share feelings of negativity - albeit, remembering that people are innately attracted to positivity, is usually a sign of having a shitty life, thus always a good reminder - you don’t want to spread the shittiness do you?

Be yourself, by yourself, but not into yourself, definitely not inflating yourself.
By being more than yourself, in it’s presently concurrent manner in terms of
>every second being lived
You are defying yourself, by exacerbating yourself into a larger you
>although, if you find none to hear you
You have honored yourself to a beacon of negativity. Congratulations.
You have amassed an achievement, that most people cannot achieve.

>They do not have shitty lives.

>Remember, if you’re life is shitty, think twice about sharing it
>You might actually lose someone you like

>Don’t worry
>We don’t need to share everything
>But to the ones we love
>We kind of have to tailor our lack of frankness
>With some nice curvature

Be safe, fellas.

In terms of this, a post-psychosis in practical understanding of psychological terms, can mean the trauma of said psychosis, in which analysis and research have shown that said trauma can be a detriment to the rest of the patient’s life. The trauma can be a daily impediment to social skills, cognitive ability, willpower and motivation, family and close relations, furthermore so many more aspects of living. It is a continuous process by psychological terms, in which (technically) a patient is defined to be in a state of permanent recovery, whether or not they become psychotic again, hence the semantics.

>I am okay with the trauma.
>I am having a problem with being myself without hurting and scaring people.

>first world problems, amirite

A post-psychosis in psychiatric terms means the process in which a mind is attempting to heal, or at least the process in which the completion of healing is in a relatively correct adjustment, in which the mind is naturally seeking a healthy state, wherein reality is no longer altered in perception, neither contorted in comprehension, nor distorted in it’s usual nominal clarity, of emotions, thoughts, decisions and memories; this process can always take decades, going up and down, even relapsing into psychosis; people who experience post-psychosis, do not revert the damage done to the brain, they are still prone to episodes to some smaller degree, as it never reaches a state in which it does not heal anymore, so to speak - however they will regain functionality to a marginal amount, sometimes exceptionally so, acquiring a “recovered patient” - it is an ongoing process in psychiatric terms.

>In psychology you focus on the emotional aspect more.
>In psychiatry you focus on apparent science, attempting to attenuate treatments.
>All neurology is meant to support this process

Lots of meme answers here, so here's something far less cool, much more bothersome, but serious: you refine yourself, improve, develop new habits, meditate, look at things from different perspectives, contemplate and consider how things relate to each other and you. Your ego with its tendencies is a matter of raising and your own flaws affecting your behavior - those can be changed if you seriously strive for it (to the point that you won't notice any progress till at some point you'll be able to look back). Uphill battle but worth it, good luck.

Alternatives? Well, ego stems from your current life, body and experiences stemming from such. Dying will indeed kill the person you think you are right now, that is the ego. Not that I recommend to do that - as people are usually who they are for a reason and contemplating and learning from it, improving is much more valuable long-term.
